enWisdom: Gluttony prevents astuteness
Overeating corrupts wisdom
Gluttony obstructs astuteness

Wisdom: إِذَا مُلِئَ الْبَطْنُ مِنَ الْمُبَاحِ عَمِيَ الْقَلْبُ عَنِ الصَّلَاحِ
enWisdom: When the stomach gets filled with the permissible, the heart becomes blind to righteousness

Wisdom: كَيْفَ تَصْفُو فِكْرَةُ مَنْ يَسْتَدِيمُ الشِّبَعَ
enWisdom: How can the thought of one who is always sated be pure?
There is no astuteness with gluttony
Gluttony and astuteness do not go together
Overeating and performing one’s obligation do not go together
Eating to one’s fill increases maladies
Habitual overeating leads to a variety of ailments

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَالْبِطْنَةَ فَمَنْ لَزِمَهَا كَثُرَتْ أَسْقَامُهُ وَفَسُدَتْ أَحْلَامُهُ
enWisdom: Be wary of gluttony, for whoever persists in it, his maladies increase and his dreams get corrupted

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَإِدْمَانَ الشِّبَعِ فَإِنَّهُ يُهَيِّجُ الْأَسْقَامَ وَيُثِيرُ الْعِلَلَ
enWisdom: You must avoid habitual overeating, for verily it induces maladies and foments diseases

Wisdom: قَلَّ مَنْ أَكْثَرَ مِنَ الطَّعَامِ فَلَمْ يَسْقَمْ
enWisdom: Few are those who increase their consumption of food and don’t fall ill [because of it]

Wisdom: كَثْرَةُ الْأَكْلِ وَالنَّوْمِ تُفْسِدَانِ النَّفْسَ وَتَجْلِبَانِ الْمَضَرَّةَ
enWisdom: Overeating and oversleeping corrupt the soul and bring about impairment
Overeating causes bad [body] odour
One who increases his overeating is cloyed by his gluttony

Wisdom: مَنْ كَظَّتْهُ الْبِطْنَةُ حَجَبَتْهُ عَنِ الْفِطْنَةِ
enWisdom: One who is cloyed by gluttony is obstructed by it from astuteness

Wisdom: مَنْ كَثُرَ أَكْلُهُ قَلَّتْ صِحَّتُهُ وَثَقُلَتْ عَلَى نَفْسِهِ مَئُونَتُهُ
enWisdom: One who eats excessively, his health deteriorates and his expenses become heavy for him to bear
Eating to one’s fill corrupts piety
What an evil companion of piety overeating is!
One who is deep in sleep is belied by his dreams

Wisdom: إِيَّاكُمْ وَالْبِطْنَةَ فَإِنَّهَا مَقْسَاةٌ لِلْقَلْبِ مَكْسَلَةٌ عَنِ الصَّلَاةِ وَمَفْسَدَةٌ لِلْجَسَدِ
enWisdom: Be wary of gluttony, for indeed it causes hardening of the heart, sluggishness in prayer and corruption of the body

Wisdom: أَمْقَتُ الْعِبَادِ إِلَى اللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ مَنْ كَانَ هِمَّتُهُ بَطْنَهُ وَفَرْجَهُ
enWisdom: The most detested servant in the sight of Allah, the Glorified, is the one whose concern (and effort) is [solely] for his stomach and his private parts
Verily the [only] concern of quadrupeds [ieanimals with four legs] is their stomachs
A man’s stomach is his enemy

Wisdom: قِلَّةُ الْأَكْلِ مِنَ الْعَفَافِ وَكَثْرَتُهُ مِنَ الْإِسْرَافِ
enWisdom: Eating less is from self-restraint and overeating is from indulgence

Wisdom: كَثْرَةُ الْأَكْلِ مِنَ الشَّرَهِ وَالشَّرَهُ شَرُّ الْعُيُوبِ [مِنَ الْعُيُوبِ‏]
enWisdom: Overeating is from gluttony, and gluttony is the worst flaw
How helpful to sins overeating is!
Overeating brings about insolence and corrupts piety
